TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
15 Iames.
SEint Iemes þe holi Apo&slong;tle &punctelev; guod is to habbe in mone
Seint Iohanes b&rrot;oþur þe Ewangeli&slong;t &punctelev; and o&rrot;e louerdes aunte sone
his Moder moder was o&rrot;e leuedi so&slong;ter &punctelev; Marie cleophe
Of guode kunne he was icome &punctelev; non betere ne miȝhte be
he auȝhte wel himself beo guod &punctelev; ase ȝe mowe alle ise
In þe londe of Samarie he p&rrot;echede &punctelev; and also in Ivde
Þo&rrot;uȝ is p&rrot;echingue mani on &punctelev; he turnde to cri&slong;tindom
To
hermogenes Hermogenes þe luþere p&rrot;ince &punctelev; þe tiþingue sone com
¶Þilke p&rrot;ince was wichche &slong;trong &punctelev; and enchauntour also
Þo&rrot;uȝ þe deuel he wolde al da&ydot; &punctelev; gret Miracle miracle do
Ane desciple he hadde of is Arte art &punctelev; philet was is name
him he sende to seint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; to fondi to don him schame
Ȝif þat he miȝhte with is Arte art &punctelev; seint Ieme ouercome
Togadere hu&ydot; comen fo&rrot;to pla&ydot;di &punctelev; ase þe da&ydot; was inome
Godes desciple and þe feondes &punctelev; bigonne to pla&ydot;di fa&slong;te
Ac seint Seint
Ieme þat was gode&slong; Godes desciple &punctelev; aboue was atþe la&slong;te
Blinde men he ȝaf heo&rrot;e sijȝht &punctelev; and maude hole in þe place
Meseles and þe crokede also &punctelev; al þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e louerdes grace
¶ Þo philet isaiȝ him þus ouercome &punctelev; to is mai&slong;ter he wende sone
Hermogenes and tolde him fo&rrot;e &punctelev; ase is riȝhte was to done
Sire he seide ne hope þov nouȝt &punctelev; to come seint Seint
Ieme with|Inne
Fo&rrot; nauȝt it is fo&rrot; þov ne schalt nouȝt &punctelev; ouercome him with al þi ginne
Þarefo&rrot;e do ase ichulle þe rede &punctelev; and go we to him we tweiȝe
And crie him merci and bicome we &punctelev; his desciples be&ydot;e
Fo&rrot; siker þou beo ichulle it do &punctelev; þei þou nelle nouȝt also.
So wroth was þe p&rrot;ince þat he nu&slong;te &punctelev; ȝwat fo&rrot; wrathþe do
Þo&rrot;uȝ &slong;trencþe of þe deueles Arte art &punctelev; he made philet anon
Þat he ne miȝhte non mo&rrot;e þane a &slong;tok &punctelev; a fot of þat &slong;tude gon
¶ Nov he seide we schullen iseo &punctelev; ȝwat Iemes þe mai don here
Ȝweþer he þe mai aȝein me vndo &punctelev; and aȝein mine gode&slong; Godes pouwere.
he liet him ligge þare ase a&slong;tok &punctelev; and fo&rrot;th awei fram him wende
Philet nam ane man anon &punctelev; and seint Seint
Ieme wo&rrot;d sende
hou fa&slong;te þo&rrot;u þe deueles miȝhte &punctelev; he lai þer ibounde
And bad him helpe his desciple &punctelev; and b&rrot;ingue þene deuel to grounde
¶ Seint Ieme him sende a lu&ydot;te cloth &punctelev; þat he with him ber
Þat he touchede him þarewith &punctelev; and seide þeos two vers of þe sauter
Ore louerd vnbind þat beoth ibounde &punctelev; and ȝif þe blinde is siȝhte
Ore louerd riȝtht heom þat buth vnriȝht &punctelev; fo&rrot; þou loue&slong;t[al. oure louerd loueþ] alle riȝhte.
¶ Þo philet hadde þis ido &punctelev; ase seint Seint
Ieme wo&rrot;d him sende
Onbounde he was of þe deueles bendes &punctelev; and ȝwodere he wolde he wende
he þrettnede fa&slong;te hermogenes Hermogenes . &punctelev; to seint Seint
Ieme sone he cam
And gode&slong; Godes desciple was and is &punctelev; and aveng cri&slong;tindom
Þo
hermogenes Hermogenes iherde þis &punctelev; þat he was so vnbounde
And þat seint Seint
Ieme hadde ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; al is dede to grounde
¶Manie deuelene he conIurede &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; to him wende
Wel ȝe wutez he seide ȝwi it is &punctelev; þat ich after eov sende
Ore alre fo Iemes hath &punctelev; mine desciple me binome
Bote ȝe beon &slong;trengo&rrot;e þane ich am &punctelev; iwis we beoth ouercome
Ich hote eov þat ȝe wenden anon &punctelev; and doth a god God p&rrot;eiȝe
Nimeth and b&rrot;inguet heom to me &punctelev; fa&slong;te ibounde beiȝe
Certes bote ȝe it mouwen do &punctelev; ase ȝe wel iseoth
Ouwer power nis nouȝt wurth an hawe &punctelev; fo&rrot; ouercome we beoth.
¶ We schulle sone þe deuelene seiden &punctelev; with heom on vrþe[Vern. a noþur] pleiȝe
Fa&slong;te ibounde al to þine wille &punctelev; we schulle heom b&rrot;ingue be&ydot;ȝe
hu&ydot; comen fleo oppe in þe loft &punctelev; ouer þe apo&slong;tle seint Seint
Ieme
And anon so hu&ydot; weren ouer him icome &punctelev; hu&ydot; guonne to grenne and reme[al. feme]
Belewi and wel foule crie &punctelev; Iemes Iemes þin o&rrot;e
We b&rrot;ennez here are it o&rrot;e t&ydot;me be &punctelev; and beth ito&rrot;mented ful so&rrot;e.
Ho to&rrot;mentede[al. to&rrot;menteþ] eov quath seint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; and ȝwat wolde ȝe nouþe here?
Bote we buth icome þe feondes seiden &punctelev; to nime þe and þi fere
Hermogenes us made hidere wiende &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ is conIuringue
Þat we eov scholden fa&slong;te ibounde &punctelev; beiȝe to him b&rrot;ingue
Bote anon so we comen here ouer þe &punctelev; Aungles aungles to us come
With b&rrot;enninde raketeiȝene &punctelev; and fa&slong;te vs bounde and nome
here hu&ydot; us beteth and to&rrot;mentieth &punctelev; with b&rrot;enninde fu&ydot;re
A we&ydot; wei Iemes ȝwat schulle we do? &punctelev; we ne mowen nouȝt þis du&ydot;re
A Iemes Iemes leoue louerd &punctelev; of us wrechches haue reuþe
And neuereft we nelleth neiȝ þe come &punctelev; pliȝhte we wolleth o&rrot;e treouþe
¶Ȝe wrechche foles quath seint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; I not ȝwat ȝe wolden here
Of þat ȝe þouȝten me anu&ydot;e &punctelev; d&rrot;awe ȝe schullen arere
Al onbounde ich ȝ&ydot;ue eov leue &punctelev; aȝein fo&rrot;to fleo
And b&rrot;inguth him þat hidere eov sende &punctelev; fa&slong;te ibounde to me
Þat ȝe ne don him non oþur harm &punctelev; fo&rrot; icholde with him speke.
Wel is us nouþe þe schrewen seide &punctelev; we wo&rrot;þet wel awreke
¶ To hermogenes Hermogenes hu&ydot; comen sone &punctelev; and to grounde him ca&slong;te
hu&ydot; d&rrot;owen him and is hondene bounden &punctelev; bihinden him wel fa&slong;te
Þus[al. þef] hu&ydot; seiden þou sende&slong;t us &punctelev; þare we gret wo ifielde
In gret to&rrot;ment and b&rrot;enningue &punctelev; and nouþe we wollez þe ȝelde
hu&ydot; harleden fo&rrot;th þusne wrechche &punctelev; and to seint Seint
Ieme heo him b&rrot;ouȝte
And seiden lo sire ȝware he is her &punctelev; þat to swuche to&rrot;ment us wrouȝte
Ȝif us fer&slong;t leue þat we moten &punctelev; o&rrot;e to&rrot;mens awreke
And þe muchele vnriȝht þat he us hath ido &punctelev; are þou with him speke!
¶ Na&ydot; certes quath þis holie man &punctelev; ȝe ne schullen nouȝt so
Fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd us hiet þat we scholden &punctelev; guod fo&rrot; vuele do
Ȝw&ydot; ne come [ȝe] nouȝt neiȝ philet &punctelev; þat &slong;tant here bi me?
Wel þou wo&slong;t þis oþure seiden &punctelev; þat we ne moten fo&rrot; þe
No. goth þanne quath seint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; to eower ku&ydot;nde &slong;tude
And ne cometh neuereft neiȝ no guod man &punctelev; þei a fol eov habbe ibede
¶Euere &slong;tod hermogenes Hermogenes &punctelev; and criede milce and o&rrot;e
he quakede fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede and fo&rrot; pine &punctelev; And wep swiþe so&rrot;e
¶Philete
philete Philete quath seint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; þes hath þe schame ido
Þov schalt don him guod aȝein vuel &punctelev; fo&rrot; mi louerd het me so
he bond þe þo þov were vnbounde &punctelev; and aȝein þulke luþere dede[The la&slong;t halflines are transposed in the MS.]
Þov schalt vnbinde him þat is bounde &punctelev; fo&rrot; so mi louerd sede.[The la&slong;t halflines are transposed in the MS.]
Philet vnbond þane wrechche &punctelev; and dude him vuel fo&rrot; guod
Þe wrechche ne do&rrot;&slong;te nouȝwoder gon fo&rrot; fere &punctelev; ake quak&ydot;inde þare he &slong;tod
Go ȝware þov wolt quath seint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; fo&rrot; mi louerd nele it nouȝt
Þat euere ani man aȝein is wille &punctelev; to him beo ib&rrot;ouȝt.
¶ A merci quath hermogenes Hermogenes &punctelev; þis deuelen me beteh[r. beten] so so&rrot;e
Þat I ne dar anne fot fram þe go &punctelev; la&slong;te hu&ydot; me nimen mo&rrot;e
hu&ydot; me wullez asle ȝif hu&ydot; me afongueth eft &punctelev; and þarefo&rrot;e ich bidde þe
Þat þov me take sum þing þat ich mouwe &punctelev; fo&rrot; heom bere with me
Seint Ieme him tok is &slong;taf on honde &punctelev; go nov fo&rrot;th he seide
Þere nis no deuel þat do&rrot;re nouþe &punctelev; neiȝ þe come fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede.
Hermogenes wende him fo&rrot;th. &punctelev; his bokes alle he nam
Þat he hadde of his enchauntemenz &punctelev; to þe Apo&slong;tle aȝein he cam
And bad þat he as fo&rrot;b&rrot;enne scholde. &punctelev; þe Apo&slong;tle sone heom nam
And ca&slong;te heom in þe deope .se &punctelev; fa&slong;te ibounde echon
¶ Hermogenes criede him merci &punctelev; and wilnede cri&slong;tindom
So þat he icri&slong;tned was &punctelev; and swiþe holi man bicam.\
Abiatar þat þo was &punctelev; Iu&slong;tise luþur inovȝ
Fo&rrot; þis dede he was wroth &punctelev; toward seint Seint
Ieme with gret wouȝ
he nam him fa&slong;te and swo&rrot; is othþ &punctelev; þat he it scholde abugge deo&rrot;e
to þe k&ydot;ingue heroudes he liet him lede &punctelev; a rop aboute is swere
Heroudes ȝaf his dom anon &punctelev; his þrote to smite atwo
And Iosie þe quellare he was bitake &punctelev; þulke dede fo&rrot;to do
Ane Rop he dude aboute is necke &punctelev; and ladde him toward is dome
Ane Man man he helde of þe palasie &punctelev; are heo þudere come
Þo Iosie þis isaiȝ &punctelev; merci anon he criede
Seint Ieme þe holie Apo&slong;tle &punctelev; he bad wel sone abide
And cri&slong;tni him in þe place &punctelev; anonriȝtes þere
Aseinte marie da&ydot; in leinte &punctelev; bihaueded boþe heo were
Ake holie curche halt of o&rrot;e leuedi &punctelev; fe&slong;te þat ilke da&ydot;
Bifo&rrot;e lamasse seueniȝht &punctelev; we holdeth is da&ydot; þerfo&rrot;e[MS. bifo&rrot;e]
Fo&rrot; þulke da&ydot;e is bodi was &punctelev; into schrine ibo&rrot;e
¶ Anon so seint Seint
Ieme þe holie man &punctelev; bihaueded was þere
his desciples him wolden lede awei &punctelev; ac hu&ydot; ne do&rrot;&slong;ten fo&rrot; fere
heo&rrot;e t&ydot;me hu&ydot; awa&ydot;teden wel &punctelev; ȝwanne none Men men þare neiȝ nere
And þat bodi wel &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; out of þe countre&ydot;e bere
In a schip hu&ydot; leiden it in þe se &punctelev; and fo&rrot;th þarewithþ hu&ydot; wende
And none ȝeme ne nomen ȝwoderward fare &punctelev; bote ase god God he[m] kende
Þat schip wende fo&rrot;th bi himseolf &punctelev; and hit cam on a da&ydot;
Into þe lond of Galeis &punctelev; þare ase þe quene la&ydot;
Þat luþur [was] and schrewe inovȝ. &punctelev; seint Iemes
Men men anon
Op of þe schipe nomen þat holie bodi &punctelev; and leiden it opon a &slong;ton
Þe &slong;ton bigan to wexe ab&rrot;od &punctelev; and holuȝ bicam amidde
Ase euene imaud to þe holie bodi &punctelev; as ani man wolde bidde
¶e scholde no man so euene a þrovȝ &punctelev; Nin lengþe and i[n] b&rrot;ede
To[al. make to] him ase þat &slong;ton bicam &punctelev; ase ech man þat it isaiȝ seide
his desciples ase it was riȝht &punctelev; to þe Quene quene ere&slong;t wende
Dame hu&ydot; seiden we habbeth ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd þe hider sende
Seint Iemes bodi his Apo&slong;tle &punctelev; of ȝwam þov nome ofte þi red
To laten him nime þe ȝw&ydot;le he was quik &punctelev; ase mani men it habbeth iseid
Ore louerd him hath hidere isent &punctelev; ase he himseolf bed.[o&rrot;ig. bad]
Loke ȝware þov him legge wolt &punctelev; fo&rrot; icome he is to þe ded.
¶E&ydot; tra&ydot;tours quath þe luþere Quen quen &punctelev; ȝweþer ȝe beon of his
Ȝwane ine miȝhte of him beo awreke &punctelev; of eov ichulle iwis
Þis guode Men men he nam echone &punctelev; and to þe king of spa&ydot;gne Spaygne heom sende
Þat he heom b&rrot;ouȝte to &slong;trong dethþe &punctelev; oþur don heom heo&rrot;e lawe wende
Echone þe king nam anon &punctelev; and in &slong;trongue p&rrot;isone heom b&rrot;ouȝte
Ac o&rrot;e louerd ne fo&rrot;ȝat heom nouȝt &punctelev; ake wel sone on heom þouȝte
Fo&rrot; an Aungel aungel fram heouene cam &punctelev; and þat p&rrot;isoun b&rrot;ak wel sone
Þo þe k&ydot;ng was þarof iwar &punctelev; he nu&slong;te ȝwat was to done
¶
Kn&ydot;ȝhtes knyȝhtes he liet siende inowe &punctelev; aftur heom wel wide
Þat febleliche agonne in heo&rrot;e neodes &punctelev; fo&rrot; schame heom gan bitide
Fo&rrot; ase hu&ydot; wolden ouer ane heiȝe b&rrot;ugge &punctelev; after þis guode men gon
Vnder heom þe b&rrot;ugge b&rrot;ak &punctelev; and hu&ydot; ad&rrot;ounken echon
¶Þo þe t&ydot;þingue to þe kingue cam &punctelev; so&rrot;i he was inovȝ
Of is luþere [þouȝt][om.] þat he þouȝte &punctelev; fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede he him withd&rrot;ovȝ
Mildeliche he to heom he sende &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; aȝein comen him to
And þat he heom wolde amendi faire &punctelev; of al þat he hadde heom misdo
Aȝein hu&ydot; wenden to þe k&ydot;ng &punctelev; and he faire aȝein heom cam
Ȝwareþo&rrot;uȝ he and al is Men men &punctelev; afenguen cri&slong;tinedom
¶Þe king sende þe Quene quene wo&rrot;d &punctelev; þat heo scholde heo&rrot;e wille al do
Ful so&rrot;i was þe Quene quene þo &punctelev; and so&rrot;e anu&ydot;d also
Ake heo ne do&rrot;&slong;te nouȝt beo aȝein is he&slong;te &punctelev; nere hire no so [wo]
Wilde bollokes heo wu&slong;te fale &punctelev; ope ane heiȝe hulle go
Gothþ heo seide ope þulke hulle &punctelev; finde ȝe mowen þere
Oxene and Bolen bolen &slong;trongue inovȝ &punctelev; fo&rrot;te leden with ouwer bere
Teiȝeth heom to þulke wa&ydot;ne &punctelev; and þat bodi leggez þarinne
And ledeth it ȝware eouwere wille beo &punctelev; godes leue ȝe habbe and minne.
¶ Fo&rrot; þe Bollokes bollokes wilde were &punctelev; þe luþere Quene quene so seide
Fo&rrot; hu&ydot; ne scholden heom temie nouȝt &punctelev; eniþing fo&rrot;to lede
his desciples wenden fo&rrot;th &punctelev; to þulke hulle heiȝe
A fu&ydot;r Drake drake þaropon &punctelev; aȝein heom cominde hu&ydot; seiȝe
Swiþe ferliche he bla&slong;te fu&ydot;r &punctelev; and asa&ydot;llede heom fa&slong;te
Mani a man he hadde aslawe &punctelev; and al þe contreie of him aga&slong;te
¶Þis desciples mauden þe signe sone &punctelev; of þe Creo&ydot;z heom bifo&rrot;e
Anon hadde þis luþere wo&rrot;m &punctelev; is pouwer al ilo&rrot;e
Þat hit ne miȝhte ane fot fo&rrot;þere passe. &punctelev; þis desciples fo&rrot;th wende
And topouneden it al to deþe &punctelev; and ech lime fram oþur rende
Þe Bollokes bollokes and þe ȝoungue &slong;teo&rrot;es &punctelev; þat weren er so wilde
Anon so hu&ydot; touward heom[superscribed.] come &punctelev; hu&ydot; woxen tame and milde
Þe be&slong;te hu&ydot; chosen þat hu&ydot; wolden &punctelev; and to þe wa&ydot;ne heom ladde
And hu&ydot; d&rrot;owen þat bodi so mildeliche &punctelev; þat ech man þarof wonder hadde
¶Þis desciples nomen seint Seint
Iemes bodi &punctelev; and opon þe wa&ydot;ne it leide
Þe be&slong;tes it d&rrot;owen fo&rrot;th wel mildeliche &punctelev; withoute eche fole b&rrot;eide
hu&ydot; comen and d&rrot;iue þane wa&ydot;n &punctelev; þare as þe Quene quene was
hire wond&rrot;ede muche and d&rrot;adde so&rrot;e &punctelev; þo heo iseiȝ þat cas
¶ Heo fo&rrot;sok hire false bileue &punctelev; and tok hire to cri&slong;tindom
Fo&rrot; þe wonder þat heo iseiȝ &punctelev; and guod womman bicom
Al hure pale&ydot;s þat heo was inne &punctelev; and al heo&rrot;e oþure bone
Fo&rrot;to honouri þat holie bodi &punctelev; heo grauntede heom wel sone
Amidde þe pale&ydot;s þis holi bodi &punctelev; hu&ydot; bureden with grete p&rrot;u&ydot;te
Þare he hath euereft to þis dai ibeo &punctelev; and so he is ȝu&ydot;te
¶Heo liet arere ane noble churche &punctelev; and gret treso&rrot; he ȝaf þarto
And gret lond þat ȝu&ydot;t þareto lijth &punctelev; and grete rentes also
Ȝwareþo&rrot;uȝ of religioun &punctelev; a gret hous nouþe þare is
Of Chanones chanones þat Men men ȝeot iseoth and sechethþ &punctelev; at seint Seint
Iemes of Gal&ydot;s
A gret pilegrimage it is iholde &punctelev; oueral ase ȝe iseothþ
To sechen þat ilke holie &slong;tude &punctelev; þare seint Seint
Iemes bones beothþ
Mani miracle is pilegrimes seggeth &punctelev; þat þare hath ofte icome
Þei we ne mouwen nouȝt alle telle &punctelev; þenche we moten on some.
¶Þritti Men men at one t&ydot;me &punctelev; pilegrimes bicome
To seint Seint
Iemes þe holie &slong;tude &punctelev; alle þene wei hu&ydot; nome
Ase hu&ydot; wenden bi þe weiȝe &punctelev; so gret loue hu&ydot; hadden and trewe
And so guod heo&rrot;te ech to oþur hadde &punctelev; þat a fo&rrot;eward hu&ydot; mauden newe
Þat non ne scholde failli oþur &punctelev; in perile ne in neode
Ake wedb&rrot;eþerne hu&ydot; bicomen echon &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; þat wei eode
heo&rrot;e treuþes hu&ydot; pliȝhten alle bote on &punctelev; ake he nolde his nouȝt pliȝte
Ake þat fo&rrot;eward he bihet to holde &punctelev; treuweliche ope al is miȝhte
¶So þat it bifeol bi þe weie &punctelev; þat on ivuelede a da&ydot;
And vnder þe hulle of seint Seint
Miȝhel &punctelev; longue sijk he la&ydot;
his felawes þat hadde him treouþe ipliȝht &punctelev; fiftene dawes þere
Abiden him; so þat heom þouȝte longue &punctelev; fo&rrot; so&rrot;e anu&ydot;de hu&ydot; were
And seiden we ne mouwen no leng abide &punctelev; late we him ligge[ligge on the margin.] &slong;tille
Do we moten o&rrot;e pilegrimage &punctelev; god do bi him is wille
hu&ydot; nomen heo&rrot;e leue and lieten him ligge &punctelev; and wenden fo&rrot;th echon
Bote þilke þat nolde is treuþe pliȝhte &punctelev; he nolde nouȝt fram him gon
¶Certes he seide god God do is wille &punctelev; and lieue eov wel to wende
I nelle anne fot fram him gon &punctelev; are ich wute of him sum ende
Mid him he bilefde al one &punctelev; fo&rrot;to þat he ded were
Betere is trewe dede þane fals wo&rrot;d &punctelev; as it was isene þere
Þis trewe Man man þat was with þe bodi &punctelev; ful so&rrot;e ad&rrot;ad he was
Fo&rrot; he was so feo&rrot; fram toune &punctelev; and no man neiȝh him nas
Fo&rrot; he was with þe dede al one &punctelev; and it was neiȝh niȝhte
he nu&slong;te ȝwat with þat bodi to do &punctelev; bote seint Seint
Ieme him helpe miȝhte
his help he bad with guode heo&rrot;te. &punctelev; and in þe eueningue riȝht
Seint Ieme cam to him ride &punctelev; in wel fair at&ydot;r of kniȝht
¶Cum here he seide fo&rrot;th with me &punctelev; ne haue þou of noþing d&rrot;ede
Bifo&rrot;e me ca&slong;t þat bodi her &punctelev; and ich it wolle hennes lede
And lupe þou up bih&ydot;nde me. &punctelev; and þo þis was al ido
Þis holie Man man ladde þene dede fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and þene quike also
F&ydot;ftene Io&rrot;neies iorneies grete are da&ydot; &punctelev; in þulke lu&ydot;tele ȝwile
To þe mount of Ioie &punctelev; þat is bisides seint Seint
Iemes a mile
Þo hu&ydot; comen to þulke Mount mount &punctelev; seint Ieme gan abide
Go he seide to þe quike manne &punctelev; to mine churche herebiside
And seiȝe mine Canones canones þat þarinne beoth &punctelev; þat ich heom wo&rrot;d bi þe sende
Mine pilegrim þat me was leof &punctelev; þat in treowenesse mine wei wende
Þat hu&ydot; him burien among heom þere &punctelev; with fair seruise and liȝhte
Fo&rrot; ded he schal þudere come &punctelev; ȝwane he aliue ne miȝhte
And seie heom þat þine felawes were &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;e wei is al ilo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e treouþe þat hu&ydot; b&rrot;eke &punctelev; heo&rrot;e felawe þat is nov bifo&rrot;e
And þine ȝw&ydot;le ichulle þe ȝelde &punctelev; þat þou ha&slong;t þus treowe ibeo.
Mid þusse wo&rrot;de he wende fo&rrot;th &punctelev; þat he ne miȝhte him nonemo&rrot;e ise
¶Aboute þat bodi fo&rrot; þis Miracle miracle &punctelev; folk cam þicke reke
Here man mai sumdel iseo &punctelev; ȝwuch [it is] treouþe to b&rrot;eke
And ȝwuch it is þane holie we&ydot; &punctelev; to seint Seint
Iemes fo&rrot;to go
Þis Miracle miracle is so Murie murie &punctelev; ich mot ȝeot telle of mo
¶Hit was a guod man and is sone &punctelev; þat toward seint Seint
Iemes wende
To þe cite of Tolouse &punctelev; aȝein eue hu&ydot; hem kende
Al niȝht hu&ydot; bilefden þere &punctelev; at ane luþere mannes Inne inne
he þouȝte with ȝwuche tricherie &punctelev; he miȝhte panewes winne
¶Nou was þe lawe in þulke &slong;tude &punctelev; as þe schrewe wel onder&slong;tod
Þat hoso anhengue anine[r. anne] man &punctelev; he scholde habbe al is guod
Þe schrewe heom made fair semblaunt &punctelev; ase is manere was to done
Þat hu&ydot; were fo&rrot;d&rrot;onke beie &punctelev; and aslepe leiȝen sone
A coppe of seluer &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; þis luþere Man man gan b&rrot;ingue
And dude in heo&rrot;e schrippe softeliche &punctelev; among heo&rrot;e oþur þingue
¶Þis guode Man man awok and is sone &punctelev; so sone so it dai was
And nomen heo&rrot;e leue and wenden fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and nu&slong;ten nouȝt of þat cas
Þo hu&ydot; come withoute toune a lu&ydot;te &punctelev; þis luþere man aftur cam
hotinde out with grete siwte &punctelev; and þis trewe men beie he nam
And seide hu&ydot; hadden is coppe i&slong;tole &punctelev; and in heo&rrot;e scrippe ibounde
Þat folk þis iliefde anon &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; þe coppe founde
¶Þis pilegrimes þei hu&ydot; treowe weren &punctelev; to dome weren ib&rrot;ouȝt
Eche manere þeofþe hu&ydot; fursoken &punctelev; ake þat folk ne liefde heom nouȝt
Fo&rrot; hu&ydot; weren inome hond habbinde &punctelev; þe court lokede anon
Þat hu&ydot; heo&rrot;e dom with heom beren &punctelev; and hangu&ydot; scholde þat on
¶Alas alas þe fader seide &punctelev; ȝweþur i schulle novþe hongue
And are ich habbe seint Seint
Ieme isouȝt &punctelev; þis file dethþ afongue?
Nai certes quath is sone &punctelev; þat nolde ich graunti þe
Fo&rrot; to beo louerd of al þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; þat þov deide&slong;t bifo&rrot;e me
hangu&ydot; ichulle fo&rrot; us boþe &punctelev; þene deth inelle nouȝt fo&rrot;sake
And also wis ase we gultlese beoth &punctelev; mine soule ich god God bitake
A mi leoue sone quath þe fader &punctelev; so ne schal it nouȝt beo
Scholde&slong;t þou deiȝe and ich libbe &punctelev; inelle neuere þane da&ydot; iseo
Swuch a child touward as þou art &punctelev; iloked it were wroþe
Þat þov scholde&slong;t hangu&ydot; and ich libbe &punctelev; ichulle hang&ydot; fo&rrot; us boþe
A fader fader quath þe sone &punctelev; be &slong;tille ich bidde þe
Fo&rrot; I nelle neuere þane da&ydot; abide &punctelev; þat þou schulle hongue bifo&rrot;e me
¶Ake go þane we&ydot; fo&rrot; us boþe &punctelev; and ichulle hang&ydot; fo&rrot; us be&ydot;e
And bide seint Seint
Ieme þat he me graunti &punctelev; sum part of þine we&ydot;e.
Bitwene þe fader and þe sone &punctelev; þe &slong;triuingue la&slong;te longue
Þat ech man hadde deol þerof &punctelev; ȝweþur scholde þene dethþ afongue
So þat it ful atþenende &punctelev; þei it were with wrongue
Þat þe sone fo&rrot; heom beiȝe &punctelev; gulteles was anhongue
¶Alas alas þe deolfole cas &punctelev; to heo&rrot;e so muche falshede
Wel ȝeo&rrot;ne boþe fader and sone &punctelev; seint Seint
Ieme help hu&ydot; bede
Welle louerd þe deol of þe fader &punctelev; gretto&rrot;e neuere non nas
Þo he isaiȝ is sone anhongue &punctelev; and fo&rrot; he gulteles was
he bite&ydot;ȝte is soule Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þo þare nas non oþur won
And is wei with so&rrot;ewe inov &punctelev; to seint Seint
Iemes he gan gon
Also wel fo&rrot; is sone ase fo&rrot; him &punctelev; seint Seint
Ieme he bad fa&slong;te
And wende þo he hadde al ido &punctelev; hamward at þe la&slong;te
Are he come þare is sone was &punctelev; him þouȝte sw&ydot;þe longue
Ȝif he miȝhte finde oþur iseo &punctelev; ani lime of him hongue
Fo&rrot; þe lawe was þere þat euerech man &punctelev; þat anhangued were
hangu&ydot; scholde þe ȝw&ydot;le ila&slong;te[al. he la&slong;te] &punctelev; and fo&rrot;to ech lime fram oþur totere
¶Þis ȝoungue Man man sixe and þritti dawes &punctelev; heng upon þe galutreo
Are is fader aȝein to him come &punctelev; þat iroted he auȝte to beo
he cam and fond him ȝu&ydot;t &punctelev; and ner him he gan teo
he weop and criede and wrong is hondene &punctelev; þat deol it was to seo
¶Leoue fader þe sone seide &punctelev; ne weop þou nouȝt to bliue
Fo&rrot; ich nam to biweope nouȝt &punctelev; ȝeot ich am aliue
Me nas neuere on eo&rrot;þe so wel &punctelev; ase me hath sethþe ibeo
Ich am ase þei ich were in heouene &punctelev; þei ich hangu&ydot; here on þis treo
Fo&rrot; seint Seint
Ieme me halt up &punctelev; and Io&ydot;e ioye inovȝ me dieth make
Me ofþuncheth þat þou so sone come &punctelev; la&slong;te þov me adoun take
Louerd þe Io&ydot;e ioye þat þe fader &punctelev; hadde þulke &slong;tounde
Þo he aftur al is so&rrot; &punctelev; his sone aliue founde
¶To toune he o&rrot;n with Io&ydot;e ioye inouȝ &punctelev; and cleopede folk wel fa&slong;te
Muche folk him siwede and al þe soþe &punctelev; iseiȝen atþe la&slong;te
Withþ gret Io&ydot;e ioye hu&ydot; nomen him adoun &punctelev; and to þe toune him b&rrot;ouȝten
Þene traitur þat him maude anhongue &punctelev; wel sone out hu&ydot; souȝten
And anhenguen him wel heiȝe anon &punctelev; and nouȝt bote he wu&ydot;rþe were
Þus seint Seint
Ieme þe holie man &punctelev; is pilegrim halp þere
¶In þe Cite cite of leouns Leouns &punctelev; a ȝoung man þare was also
Þat ofte wende to seint Seint
Iemes &punctelev; and gret loue hadde þarto
At one t&ydot;me ase he þudere wolde &punctelev; he dude er ane folie
Þat manie Men men to helle b&rrot;ingueth &punctelev; þe sunne of lecherie
Toward seint Seint
Iemes he wende fo&rrot;thþ &punctelev; are he ischriue were
Þe deuel was wel ȝeo&rrot;ne aboute &punctelev; ȝif he miȝhte him mislere
¶Aȝein him he cam in þe wei &punctelev; swiþe milde and softe
Riȝht ase it seint Seint
Ieme were &punctelev; ase þe schrewe g&ydot;leth men wel ofte
Ȝwo&slong;t þou euere he seide ho ich am &punctelev; þe ȝoungue man seide na&ydot;
Icham þilke he seide þat þov ha&slong;t &punctelev; Iserued wel mani a da&ydot;
Seint Ieme toward ȝwam þou art. &punctelev; I ne ma&ydot; make no mone
Of þe þat þov wel ne de&slong;t &punctelev; of eche þingue bote of one
Þat þou du&slong;t[MS. dẹu&slong;t; du&slong;t=dude&slong;t] lecherie &punctelev; are þou wende&slong;t to me
Among alle men ȝif þat nere &punctelev; me&slong;t ich p&rrot;eisie þe.
¶Seint Ieme merci quath þis man &punctelev; ich crie þe milce and o&rrot;e
Fo&rrot;ȝif me þulke luþere sunne &punctelev; inelle don as neuereft mo&rrot;e.
Ov beau frere quath þe schrewe &punctelev; &slong;trong is þe misdede
Þov ne miȝht me neuere pa&ydot;e wel &punctelev; bote þov do ase ich rede
Þe menb&rrot;e þov mo&slong;t keruen of &punctelev; ȝwarewithþ þou isunegut ha&slong;t
Þe sunne ichulle fo&rrot;ȝiue þe þanne &punctelev; ȝwanne he is fram þe ica&slong;t
Ak next me þou scholde&slong;t in Io&ydot;e ioye beo &punctelev; in þe blisse of heouene aboue
Ȝif þou wolde&slong;t beon a mart&ydot;r &punctelev; and þiseolf martri fo&rrot; mi loue
¶A louerd seint Seint
Ieme quath þis man &punctelev; þov haue merci of me
Ichulle mine sunnes to bete misulf martri &punctelev; and fo&rrot;to pa&ydot;ȝe þe.
Þis wrechche Man man carf of is memb&rrot;es &punctelev; and awei fram him ca&slong;te
And sethþe þo&rrot;uȝ þe false þeues rede &punctelev; himself he aslovȝ atþe la&slong;te
Ful redi was þe schrewe þer &punctelev; þe soule he nam anon
And wel glad þarewith in his manere &punctelev; toward helle he gan gon
Ne furȝat nouȝt seint Seint
Ieme is pilegrim &punctelev; fo&rrot; þat cas þat him gan bi|tide
Aȝein þe deuel he cam adoun &punctelev; and bad þane schrewe abide
And seide þou ber&slong;t mo&rrot;e þane þin owe. &punctelev; þat i schal ku&ydot;þe þe
Ȝwi ha&slong;t þou mine pilegrim bitraid? &punctelev; gret schame þou de&slong;t me.
Ȝe al fo&rrot; nauȝt quath þe schrewe &punctelev; þou art hidere icome
In his sunne himsulf he aslouȝ &punctelev; and þarewith ich him habbe inome
Ne ma&ydot; no man in dedlich sunne &punctelev; into heuene wende
Ase wel þou miȝht gon hom aȝein &punctelev; he is min withouten enden
¶Bel am&ydot; quath seint Seint
Ieme &punctelev; þou bitraide&slong;t him with falshede
And with tricherie þou to him come. &punctelev; lat him gon ich rede!
Ich habbe leue quath þe schrewe &punctelev; to big&ydot;li and bitra&ydot;e also
Mid eche quointise þat ich mai. &punctelev; ȝwi wolde he aftur me do?
Þis &slong;trif ila&slong;te bitwene hem longue. &punctelev; ake þo seint Seint
Ieme ne miȝhte
habbe þe soule ne withinne him come &punctelev; with no resun ne riȝhte
Þou schalt he seide come with me &punctelev; to an herre Iu&slong;tise iustise
Þat þe schal cu&ydot;þe þi tricherie &punctelev; of ȝwam þe schal agrise
Bifo&rrot;e o&rrot;e leuedi swete and milde &punctelev; þane schrewe he gan lede
he ȝal and quakede deolfulliche &punctelev; þo he iseiȝ hire fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede
¶Þov luþere þing o&rrot;e leuedi seide &punctelev; ȝwi fonde&slong;te in alle wise
To binime us and bitraiȝe men &punctelev; þat beth in ovre seruise
Þou ne schalt neuere þe soule b&rrot;ouke &punctelev; fo&rrot; þine tricherie
leoue leuedi quath þe schrewe &punctelev; merci ich þe crie
Vnder&slong;tond þat ich habbe leue &punctelev; to big&ydot;lie men inouȝ
And þat ich fond him in dedlich sunne &punctelev; and þareinne himsulf he slov
And no man neuere in swuch cas &punctelev; to heuene come ne miȝhte
Ase he is min mid alle lawe &punctelev; hold me ich bidde to riȝhte!
¶Þov luþere be&slong;t o&rrot;e leuedi seide &punctelev; to muche ower pouwer is
Alas þat men nellez beon iwar &punctelev; are hu&ydot; don amis
Ase þou mid þine tricherie &punctelev; his lijf him binome
Also ichulle him ȝiuen aȝein &punctelev; is lijf with riȝhte dome
So þat þe ne tit of him no part &punctelev; fo&rrot; guod man he wo[l] ȝeot be
Ore leuedi made þe soule anon &punctelev; to þe bodi aȝen fleo
Fram deþe to liue he aros &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e leuedi o&rrot;e
And guod lijf ladde euere afturward &punctelev; and þe deuel doutede þe mo&rrot;e
¶His menb&rrot;es þat he carf of &punctelev; euereft he dude misse
Bote a lu&ydot;tel wise ȝwareþo&rrot;uȝ he miȝhte &punctelev; ȝwane he wolde pisse
Manie Men men fo&rrot; þulke miracle &punctelev; seint Ieme louieth þe mo&rrot;e
Nou bidde we ȝeo&rrot;ne euerechone &punctelev; seint Seint
Ieme milse and o&rrot;e
Þat he fo&rrot; þat holie &slong;tude &punctelev; þat he hath in galiz Galiz
helpe us and alle is pilegrimes &punctelev; and b&rrot;ingue us to heouene blis
